description: System-generated primary key for the asset record; unique and immutable.
Business asset identifier (e.g., fleet or unit number), sometimes including component notation; used by operations to reference the asset.
Short free-text name of the asset, such as make/model or common descriptor.
Code for the asset’s assigned home location/garage; references a locations table.
Code for the asset’s current or last known location; references a locations table.
Owning or responsible department/cost center code.
Likely the operational line, route, or line of business to which the asset is assigned; confirm with SME.
Code representing lifecycle/operational status (e.g., active, out of service, retired); mapped from a status reference.
System-computed priority used for scheduling or maintenance planning.
Manually set priority that can override or complement the calculated priority.
Likely the asset category or fleet type code (bus, support vehicle, equipment); confirm with SME.
Identifier of the parent asset in a hierarchy, indicating this is a component or sub-asset.
Reference to the manufacturer entity for the asset.
Reference to the vendor that sold or provided the asset.
Likely the user or role responsible for the asset (supervisor/manager); confirm with SME.
Manufacturer’s serial number; for vehicles this may be the VIN.
Manufacturer model designation for the asset.
Facility building identifier where the asset is stored or assigned.
Label suggests facility floor; however, values resemble model year. Likely repurposed to store year of manufacture; confirm with SME.
Specific room or bay within a facility where the asset is located.
Organization’s fixed-asset tag number physically affixed to the asset.
Identifier of the fueling card assigned to the asset for fuel purchases.
Timestamp of the most recent recorded activity related to the asset (e.g., movement, maintenance, audit).
Date the asset was purchased or capitalized.
Acquisition cost of the asset, excluding installation.
Date the asset was installed or placed into service.
Cost to install/commission the asset, separate from purchase price.
Date the asset was retired from service or disposed.
Estimated cost to replace the asset at current prices.
Planned service life in years used for lifecycle planning and depreciation.
Estimated cost per hour of maintenance-related downtime for the asset.
Likely operating or production cost rate per hour used for valuation or downtime impact; confirm with SME.
System timestamp of the last change to this record.
The customer or internal client associated with the asset, if applicable.
Timestamp recorded by the application for the last user-initiated change; may mirror the system last-modified time.
Geographic latitude of the asset’s current or last known position, in decimal degrees.
Geographic longitude of the asset’s current or last known position, in decimal degrees.
User account that created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User account that last modified the record.
Timestamp of the last modification by a user.
